body.p: This document describes the configuration process and requirements for the HP Helion OpenStack 2.0 Load Balancing as a Service module.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack must be installed.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: You can create a new Load Balancer by executing the following command from the deployer. The load balancing service is installed by default and does not require installation before configuration. Before running the commands, be sure you have your private network set up with a router, namespaces and active virtual machines.

ol.li: You can list the available services/agents on the system with the agent-list command. neutron agent-list
You can list the available networks on the system with the net-list command. neutron net-list
Using the Compute command-line client, nova, you can display the available virtual machines and their IP addresses by using the list command. nova list
Create the new load balancer using the lbass-loadbalancer-create command and giving the load balancer a name and network. neutron lbass-loadbalancer-create --name lb sub

Create a new listener for the load balancer using the lbass-listener-create command and giving the listener the name of the load balancer, the protocol, the protocol port and a name for the listener. neutron lbass-listener-create --loadbalancer lb --protocol HTTP --protocol-port=80 --name listener

Create a new pool for the load balancer using the lbass-pool-create command. Creating a new pool requires the load balancing algorithm, the name of the listener, the protocol and a name for the pool. neutron lbass-pool-create --lb-algorithm ROUND_ROBIN --listener listener --protocol HTTP --name pool

You can add members to the load balancer pool by running the lbass-member-create command. The command requires the subnet, IP address, protocol port and the name of the pool for each virtual machine you'd like to include into the load balancer pool. neutron lbaas-member-create --subnet sub --address 10.0.0.5 --protocol-port 80 pool
Display the current state of the load balancer and values with lbass-loadbalancer-show. neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-show lb

section.p: You can test the load balancer configuration by adding the IP address of the load balancer to the environment variable no_proxy and executing curl.

ol.li: Add load balancer IP to no_proxy environment variable. export no_proxy=$no_proxy,10.0.0.7
Run curl with load balancer IP address.curl 10.0.0.7
